section.name: Java Wrappers for the OpenMM C API
section.p: Force Field X makes use of OpenMM via Java wrappers for the OpenMM C API.
The wrappers are automatically generated using Jnaerator and are available on Github in case they may be useful to others:

p.a: Java Wrappers for the OpenMM C API

subsection.name: Environment Variables needed to use OpenMM within Force Field X on Linux / MacOS
subsection.p: To use the OpenMM Java wrappers, two environment variables need to be set (e.g. in .bash_profile) in order to invoke the OpenMM libraries from within a Java program. First, the JNA_LIBRARY_PATH variable needs to point to the location of the lib subdirectory of the OpenMM installation package.
Second, the OPENMM_PLUGIN_DIR variable needs to point to the location of the plugins subdirectory of the OpenMM installation package.

subsection.name: Environment Variables needed to use OpenMM within Force Field X on Windows
subsection.p: To use the OpenMM Java wrappers on Windows, three environment variables need to be set or updated in order to invoke the OpenMM libraries from within a Java program (e.g. Force Field X). First, set the OPENMM_LIBRARY variable to point to the location of the lib subdirectory of the OpenMM installation package. For example, from within a Windows Git BASH shell type:
Second, the OPENMM_PLUGIN_DIR variable needs to point to the location of the plugins subdirectory of the OpenMM installation package.

Finally, append the Windows PATH environment variable to include 1) the OpenMM library location (i.e. using the OPENMM_LIBRARY environment variable defined above), 2) the location of the CUDA compiler (nvcc), and 3) the Microsoft Visual Studio compiler (cl). Note that items 2 and 3 may already be configured as a result of installing the nVidia GPU Computing Toolkit and Microsoft Visual Studio.
subsection.source: export PATH="$PATH:$OPENMM_LIBRARY:/c/Program Files/NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit/CUDA/v9.0/bin:/c/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft Visual Studio 14.0/VC/bin"
